sections.heading: Lightweight and Interpreted
content: JavaScript is a lightweight scripting language that runs directly in the browser without the need for compilation.
It is interpreted at runtime, making development faster and more flexible.

sections.heading: Dynamic Typing
content: Variables in JavaScript are not bound to any specific data type. A variable can hold different types of data at different points in time.
This provides great flexibility in coding but may lead to unexpected results if not handled carefully.

sections.heading: Platform Independence
content: JavaScript runs in all major browsers and platforms without modification.
This makes it ideal for building cross-platform web applications.
